content.title: National Award For Senior Citizens (vayoshreshtha Samman): Best Urban Local Body In Providing Services And Facilities To Senior Citizens
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: Every year, the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India confers the 'National Award for Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman)' to the eminent and outstanding senior citizens and institutions/organizations involved in rendering distinguished service for the cause of elderly persons, especially indigent senior citizens. The awards are conferred on 1st October every year by the Hon’ble President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi. The 'Vayoshreshtha Samman: Best Urban Local Body in Providing Services and Facilities to Senior Citizens' award shall be given to municipal bodies, which have done outstanding work for senior citizens. A total of 11 awards are given along with a Certificate, a Memento and also Cash Award. The total number of Awardees is 15 (Fifteen). The Awards are given across 13 categories.
benefits: Boarding and lodging expenses for awardees and one companion
Reimbursement of to-and-fro travelling expenses and accommodation
eligibility: Municipal Bodies or Cantonment Boards or Other Statutory Urban Local Bodies with outstanding work for senior citizens
Exemplary contribution in the field of Health, Counselling, Legal aid, awareness, institutional and non-institutional programmes for the elderly
Significant role in the empowerment of elder people at the village level
Outstanding achievement in the involvement and participation of local people or community in the promotion of care for the elderly
Promotion of barrier-free environment in public buildings
content.application_process: Online application through the National Awards Portal.
documents_required: Proof of Parent Organisation or Registered Body
Details of the Managing Committee and Qualification of their Members
Details of NGO working at Regional/State/National/International Level
Total staff strength of the NGO
Annual Reports for the last 3 years
Special or Outstanding Achievements during the last 5 years
Details of Awards or Honours received

faqs.question: What are the objectives of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to honour the eminent and outstanding senior citizens and institutions/organizations involved in rendering distinguished service for the cause of elderly persons, especially indigent senior citizens.

faqs.question: When are these awards conferred?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred on 1st of October every year.

faqs.question: What is the address of Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi?
faqs.answer: The address of Vigyan Bhawan is: Maulana Azad Rd, Rajpath Area, Central Secretariat, New Delhi, Delhi 110011.

faqs.question: How many categories are there in this award?
faqs.answer: The Awards are given across 13 categories: 07 Institutional Categories and 06 categories of individual type.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of The Cash Award In The Institutional Category?
faqs.answer: The maximum amount of the cash award in the Institutional Category is ₹ 10,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Will the to-and-from travelling expenses of the awardee be reimbursed?
faqs.answer: Yes, the to-and-fro travelling expenses and accommodation for up to one day prior to and after the date of the Samman ceremony shall be arranged and the expenditure shall be reimbursed by the Central Government.

faqs.question: Are there any awards for urban local bodies?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is an award for the 'Best Urban Local Body in providing services and Facilities to Senior Citizens' under the Institutional Category.

faqs.question: Can I nominate myself for this award?
faqs.answer: No, Self-nominations for the Awards shall not be considered.

faqs.question: What is the URL of the national awards portal?
faqs.answer: National Awards Portal, Ministry of Home Affairs at https://awards.gov.in.

faqs.question: Where can I find the PDF of the scheme guidelines?
faqs.answer: The PDF of the Scheme Guidelines can be found at - https://socialjustice.gov.in/writereaddata/UploadFile/Englishfull169.pdf.
